1.content:
A streak of lightning split across the sky after a roar of thunder. The rain poured down like hail as the monstrous waves crashed against the sides of the white yacht that floated without course in the middle of the ocean. Will Mason, a young sailor, stood at the mast trying to direct his ship through the chaos. In his few years of sailing he had never come across anything like this. Just five minutes ago it was as pretty as a postcard image. Then all of sudden it’s the perfect storm.
Will’s boat cut through another wave coming down with a huge splash. The rain worsened falling harder. Will lost all visibility of his surroundings. He hung on the mast for dear life as he heard a rolling booming crash coming toward him. The floor disappeared beneath his feet. Will tumbled down into the dark waters below as a rogue wave took his only refuge.

She looked at you with eyes like the very storm you had just been in. The eyes had a far-away look in them, as if the woman wasn't really looking at you, but into your very soul.
"Wh-where am I?" you asked, your voice cracking slightly with the amount of salt water you had swallowed "Who are you?"
"Your location is of no consequence," said the woman "Only your choice. You are not supposed to be here, but this is a unique opportunity for me."
In the time it took you to blink, the woman was next to you, looking right into your eyes, a thoughtful expression on her face.
"You are supposed to be dead, Will Mason," said the woman "Instead you translated from reality to abstraction. You have a choice to make here: I can send you on, to your rest in the land beyond. You have led a good life, Will Mason, and a just reward awaits you. in the Fields of Ellysium."
"And the second option?" asked Will. He wasn't really ready to die yet, no matter what reward awaited him.
"I will send you back to your world," said the woman "But I must warn you, that you shall not be unchanged. Exactly what changes you will go through, I do not know, but I do know you will gain abilities that most people only dream of. You will act as my agent in the world, I will give you tasks to complete from time to time, and if you do not complete them, our agreement ends, and you shall go to your rest. But know that the judges may not look as favourably on you then as they do now, if you should shirk these responsibilities."
